Clip.Title: QUEST
Clip.Episode: Condors vs. Lead Bullets, Endangered Elk Return and Please Touch the Animals
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Once nearly extinct, California condors are making a steady recovery. But a new threat - lead poisoning from old bullets - is slowing progress. And Tule Elk thanks to naturalists and inspired ranchers, are making a comeback. And zookeepers are using a lighter touch to keep their animals strong and healthy.

Clip.Title: QUEST
Clip.Episode: Earth Day: Where We've Been, Where We're Headed
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Protecting the earth and the environment hasn't always been a primary concern. Journey back in time to explore how environmental dangers sparked the birth of a movement and the creation of the first "Earth Day" in 1970. Today, these "environmentalists" continue to inspire a new generation.

Clip.Title: KURU: SCIENCE AND THE SORCERY
Clip.EpisodeSummary: An Australian researcher discovers the cause of a crippling plague in New Guinea, and finds how the affliction the isolated tribe suffers from became a global concern.

Clip.Title: GREEN PARADISE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Discover destinations around the world, where local economies protect natural resources and wildlife diversity.

Clip.Title: GREEN PARADISE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Discover destinations around the world, where local economies protect natural resources and wildlife diversity.

Clip.Title: MAGNIFICA ITALIA
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Umbria is the green heart of Italy and one of its smallest regions. It inspires spirituality and calm with its artistic cities and incontaminated nature. History relives in the traditional feasts and commemorations taking places all over the region.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The west coast of Newfoundland is a story of cultural history and beauty - from the first European settlements at l'Anse aux Meadows and Port au Choix, to the incredible, scenic beauty of Gros Morne National Park.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: A journey along Nova Scotia's Bay of Fundy coastline is a cultural and geological marvel - from historic Acadian Villages, to world-famous stone formations - rising from the sea.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The west coast of Newfoundland is a story of cultural history and beauty - from the first European settlements at l'Anse aux Meadows and Port au Choix, to the incredible, scenic beauty of Gros Morne National Park.

Clip.Episode: Earth Day: Where We've Been, Where We're Headed
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Protecting the earth and the environment hasn't always been a primary concern. Journey back in time to explore how environmental dangers sparked the birth of a movement and the creation of the first "Earth Day" in 1970. Today, these "environmentalists" continue to inspire a new generation.

Clip.Title: KURU: SCIENCE AND THE SORCERY
Clip.EpisodeSummary: An Australian researcher discovers the cause of a crippling plague in New Guinea, and finds how the affliction the isolated tribe suffers from became a global concern.

Clip.Title: THE BIONIC VET
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The Bionic Vet and his staff must save a tiny chinchilla that has broken both of his arms and a Labrador puppy that needs a bionic appendage that exactly mirrors his diseased bone to save his life.

Clip.Title: UNDERSEA EDENS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Off the eastern coast of Australia lies the Great Barrier Reef - a natural structure so large it stretches for over 1,200 miles and can be seen from outer space. This 6,000 year old underwater empire has been built from as many as 400 different species of coral, and holds some of the world's most iconic animals like clownfish, green sea turtles and barracudas.

Clip.Title: VENOM ISLANDS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: On a string of Southern Indonesian islands, poisonous predators lurk, each with its own toxic cocktail suited to its hunting style. Some bite. Some sting. Some strike quickly, while others deliver their own slow brand of death.

Clip.Title: ELEPHANT KING
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Mayhem is about to break out in Namibia's Etosha National Park. This sprawling, arid land plays host to the highest concentration of elephants on Earth, and they've recently lost their leader. The quest to become the new elephant king is on, and the candidates are all six-ton giants, willing to throw their weight around.

Clip.Title: AERIAL FRANCE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Get an up close look at the beautiful French landscape from above and a taste of the rich culture on the stunning coasts.

Clip.Title: WALRUS TV
Clip.EpisodeSummary: In depth vignettes on issues impacting modern Canadians, taken from the pages of the popular Magazine.

Clip.Title: WALRUS TV
Clip.EpisodeSummary: In depth vignettes on issues impacting modern Canadians, taken from the pages of the popular Magazine.

Clip.Title: L.A. FROCK STARS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Vintage clothing store owner Doris Raymond is always on the lookout for the "Holy Grail"; the iconic piece that has been touched by one of the world's greatest designers. During a trip to an expo show in Dallas, she learns of such a garment, found discarded at the bottom of a closet

Clip.Title: L.A. FROCK STARS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The history of 20th-century America is on display at Doris Raymond's vintage clothing boutique, The Way We Wore(R). Decades of high fashion from iconic designers fill the racks of this boutique, each telling a story about society at the time.

Clip.Title: THE REAL STORY
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Get the real story behind some of the silver screen's most iconic films and characters.

Clip.Title: HAITI'S TREASURES: OUT OF THE RUBBLE
Clip.Episode: HAITI'S TREASURES: OUT OF THE RUBBLE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: It's an incredible story of treasures saved, and hope restored. In the aftermath of the devastating 2010 earthquake in Port-au-Prince, Haiti, a cultural recovery project is born. The Smithsonian Institution, in collaboration with the Haitian government, embark on a mission to restore thousands of damaged artworks gathered from the ruins of public museums, private galleries, and toppled cathedrals.

Clip.Title: L.A. FROCK STARS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Vintage clothing store owner Doris Raymond is always on the lookout for the "Holy Grail"; the iconic piece that has been touched by one of the world's greatest designers.
